intro: Henckelia khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically followed by small, capsule-like fruits. This species is often found in moist, shaded areas of dense forests, thriving in the humid climate of its native habitat.
